title: Where I've been (for work)
name: Where I've been (for work)
description:
A Map by Jenmiwri

I travel a lot for work, so here's a bunch of places where I've been...

properties.name: Azul
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri 1250 Prospect Street, la jolla, california, 92037This was a great place to eat, but it had an even better view. I guess you could go at night, but I\'d rather go during the day when you can see the ocean outside (and the prices are a little lower...) The staff is great. The buffett was out of chocolate covered strawberries, and when we noticed it, we sort of said to each other, "that\'s too bad. I really liked those" or something along those lines. Not 5 minutes later, the waiter shows up AT OUR TABLE with a plate of freshly dipped chocolate covered strawberries. That\'s what I call service. We did tip well.

properties.name: Bob Bullock Texas State History Museum
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri  1800 N. Congress Avenue, austin, texasSince we\'d gone to the Colorado State Museum when we were in Denver, it made sense to check out this museum in Texas. We only ended up with enough time to see their multi-media "The Story of Texas", which was cool enough on its own. We did manage to get into see an IMAX movie about the moon becuase the theater stayed open longer than the museum did.

properties.name: Central Region Office
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri813 fox lane, waterford, wiAh Waterford. So glad I don\'t live there. But glad other people do so that I can have a staff member there!

properties.name: Colorado History Museum
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri   1300 Broadway, denver, coloradoI always try to work in something interesting when I\'m on the road. This was a pretty decent museum.

properties.name: Hampton Inn & Suites Vancouver-Downtown, B.C.
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri This was great! I got upgraded to the jacuzzi room and had a great view of downtown. I really love the new upgraded Hampton Inn and Suites in general. Cheaper than a lot of the other Hilton chains, but nice rooms, free breakfast, and very nice beds.

properties.name: LAME Hilton
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri 701 W ocean blvd, long beach, caVery pretty place, but there was NO internet connection in the room. After 30 minutes with their tech support, I had to spend 60 cents per minute in the business center to get any work done! Beyond weak at this "level of service"

properties.name: Museum of Modern Art
properties.description: Posted by Meredithg  11 West 53 Street, New York, NY 10019

properties.name: Oceanside Pier
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri1 ocean pier, oceanside, caI live here, so it almost doesn\'t count, but I bring my staff here when they visit me, so I\'ll stick it on the map. I should really here go more often on my own, becuase it\'s really beautiful. The food at Ruby\'s isn\'t too bad. But the fact that you have to walk out on the pier to get there makes it worth it!

properties.name: Phoenix Zoo (at Night)
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri455 N. Galvin Parkway , phoenix, azAs part of a conference, we got to spend some time at the Phoenix Zoo - decorated with lights for the Holidays. It was fun (but I still think the one where I grew up in Washington is better). We saw a talking giraffe, and lots of light decorations that really don\'t show up well in pictures, unfortunately.

properties.name: Safe House Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri 779 N. Front St, milwaukee, wisconsinThis restaurant is fun. You have to know the password to get in and they take their theme seriously. I was there on Halloween, so it wasn\'t very crowded - but that meant it was easier to explore. The food\'s okay - you go for the ambiance

properties.name: That square in Philadelphia near Ben Franklin on top of a building
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri1201 Market Street , philadelphia, paPhiladelphia is pretty cool - both because it\'s a neat city and because I\'m usually cold when I\'m there.

properties.name: The Beach!
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri  The beach, carlsbad, caIt was the end of a long day of training, so I asked my new staff member if there was anything in the area she hadn\'t had a chance to do yet that she wanted to do. She said she\'d like to play catch on the beach. So we did - it was a blast!

properties.name: Tratoria Acqua
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri1298 Prospect Street, la jolla, ca, 92037Super Yummy! And the waiters have a sense of humor too - I was getting the check, and someone else asked the waiters to fake a check that was 3 time more than I was expecting to pay. I was a little nonplussed, but after I\'d figured the whole thing out, I did have to laugh. It would have been funnier if it had been someone else, of course...

properties.name: Wild Animal Park
properties.description: Posted by Jenmiwri 15500 San Pasqual Valley Road, escondido, caI decided to take the staff to the Wild Animal Park after one of our staff meetings. We were due for some staff bonding, and since we all work in different parts of the country, that\'s not all that easy to get! Everyone seemed to really enjoy themselves. Now I just have to come up with something better for next time!
